OrgName: TNC (US) Holdings, Inc. and including the following affiliated companies and trade names: The Nielsen Company (US), LLC, ACNielsen Corporation
PPLoc: http://www.nielsen.com/intl-campaigns/eu/safe-harbor.html  Safe Harbor Employee Safe Harbor Privacy Policy is available on Nielsen
activities: Nielsen is a global information and measurement company with leading market positions in marketing and consumer information, television and other media measurement, online intelligence, mobile measurement, and related assets. The personal information collected by Nielsen from the EEA and/or Switzerland includes personal data from consumers that participate in our online (including mobile) and offline panels and surveys, access and/or use our products, services and/or platforms, as well as those that directly contact us. We also maintain contact information of representatives of our clients and business participants. The data are used for market research analysis purposes and to enable consumers to access and use our products and services. The contact information of the representatives is used to facilitate data collection to enable research analysis or other activities. Nielsen also receives employee personal information from Nielsen affiliates in the EEA and Switzerland for personnel management, operations management, security management, and legal and regulatory compliance purposes. For clarity, Nielsen’s Safe Harbor certification applies equally to the operations of companies Nielsen has acquired.
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
personaldata: Off-line, on-line, electronically stored and manually processed information.
privacyprograms: We do not currently participate in any privacy programs for Safe Harbor purposes.
recoursemech: If an issue cannot be resolved through Nielsen’s internal dispute resolution mechanism, data subjects may submit the complaint to JAMS (www.jamsadr.com/contactus/fbGeneral.aspx?xpST=submitaCase). Employees may submit complaints to their local European Data Protection Authorities (EU DPAs).
